verses.verse: Ephraim <S%H669><s%> feeds <S%H7462><s%> on wind, <S%H7307><s%> and follows <S%H7291><s%> after the east <S%H6921><s%> wind: he daily <S%H3605><s%> <S%H3117><s%> increases <S%H7235><s%> lies <S%H3576><s%> and desolation; <S%H7701><s%> and they do make <S%H3772><s%> a covenant <S%H1285><s%> with the Assyrians, <S%H804><s%> and oil <S%H8081><s%> is carried <S%H2986><s%> into Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

The LORD <S%H3068><s%> has also a controversy <S%H7379><s%> with Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and will punish <S%H6485><s%> Jacob <S%H3290><s%> according to his ways; <S%H1870><s%> according to his doings <S%H4611><s%> will he recompense <S%H7725><s%> him.
He took his brother <S%H251><s%> by the heel <S%H6117><s%> in the womb, <S%H990><s%> and by his strength <S%H202><s%> he had power <S%H8280><s%> with God: <S%H430><s%>

Yes, he had power <S%H7786><s%> over <S%H413><s%> the angel, <S%H4397><s%> and prevailed: <S%H3201><s%> he wept, <S%H1058><s%> and made supplication <S%H2603><s%> to him: he found <S%H4672><s%> him in Bethel, <S%H1008><s%> and there <S%H8033><s%> he spoke <S%H1696><s%> with us;
Even the LORD <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> of hosts; <S%H6635><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> is his memorial. <S%H2143><s%>
Therefore turn <S%H7725><s%> you to your God: <S%H430><s%> keep <S%H8104><s%> mercy <S%H2617><s%> and judgment <S%H4941><s%>and wait <S%H6960><s%> on your God <S%H430><s%> continually. <S%H8548><s%>
He is a merchant, <S%H3667><s%> the balances <S%H3976><s%> of deceit <S%H4820><s%> are in his hand: <S%H3027><s%> he loves <S%H157><s%> to oppress. <S%H6231><s%>

And Ephraim <S%H669><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> Yet <S%H389><s%> I am become <S%H6238><s%> rich, <S%H6238><s%> I have found <S%H4672><s%> me out substance: <S%H202><s%> in all <S%H3605><s%> my labors <S%H3018><s%> they shall find <S%H4672><s%> none <S%H3808><s%> iniquity <S%H5771><s%> in me that were sin. <S%H2399><s%>

And I that am the LORD <S%H3068><s%> your God <S%H430><s%> from the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> will yet <S%H5750><s%> make you to dwell <S%H3427><s%> in tabernacles, <S%H168><s%> as in the days <S%H3117><s%> of the solemn <S%H4150><s%> feast. <S%H4150><s%>

I have also spoken <S%H1696><s%> by the prophets, <S%H5030><s%> and I have multiplied <S%H7235><s%> visions, <S%H2377><s%> and used similitudes, <S%H1819><s%> by the ministry <S%H3027><s%> of the prophets. <S%H5030><s%>

Is there iniquity <S%H205><s%> in Gilead? <S%H1568><s%> surely <S%H389><s%> they are vanity: <S%H7723><s%> they sacrifice <S%H2076><s%> bullocks <S%H7794><s%> in Gilgal; <S%H1537><s%> yes, <S%H1571><s%> their altars <S%H4196><s%> are as heaps <S%H1530><s%> in the furrows <S%H8525><s%> of the fields. <S%H7704><s%>

And Jacob <S%H3290><s%> fled <S%H1272><s%> into the country <S%H7704><s%> of Syria, <S%H758><s%> and Israel <S%H3478><s%> served <S%H5647><s%> for a wife, <S%H802><s%> and for a wife <S%H802><s%> he kept <S%H8104><s%> sheep.
And by a prophet <S%H5030><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> brought <S%H5927><s%> Israel <S%H3478><s%> out of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> and by a prophet <S%H5030><s%> was he preserved. <S%H8104><s%>

Ephraim <S%H669><s%> provoked him to anger <S%H3707><s%> most <S%H8563><s%> bitterly: <S%H8563><s%> therefore shall he leave <S%H5203><s%> his blood <S%H1818><s%> on him, and his reproach <S%H2781><s%> shall his LORD <S%H113><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> to him.
